snippet: The secretive industry driving armed conflict and rampant drug abuse was worth as much as $31 billion in 2014, almost half of the nation’s entire gross domestic product, according to a report.
abstract: London-based anticorruption organization estimates value of Myanmar's underground jade industry to be $31 billion, much larger than previously thought, with vast quantities smuggled into China; claims trade illegally enriches country's political and military elites, fuels drug addiction and disease among ethnic miners and possibly implicates major multinational corporations with ties to industry; revelation poses important test for United States foreign policy toward Myanmar

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The secretive industry driving armed conflict and rampant drug abuse was worth as much as $31 billion in 2014, almost half of the nation’s entire gross domestic product, according to a report.

headline.print_headline: Myanmar’s Jade Trade Is a $31 Billion ‘Heist,’ Report Says
headline.main: Myanmar’s Jade Trade Is a $31 Billion ‘Heist,’ Report Says
